metadata.title: CVE-2023-22995 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 5.17, an error path indwc3_qcom_acpi_register_core in drivers/usb/dwc3/dwc3-qcom.c lacks certainplatform_device_put and kfree calls.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-22995` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-100-generic - 5.15.0-100.110
linux-image-5.15.0-100-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-100.110
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-100-generic - 5.15.0-100.110
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-100-generic-64k - 5.15.0-100.110
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-28-generic - 5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1
linux-image-5.19.0-28-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-100.110').
linux-hwe-5.19 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1052.57').
